p: The incidence of DNSI has been shown to be higher in patients with underlying HIV infection [ 2]. A Taiwanese study quoted the incidence of DNSI in HIV-infected patients at around 57/10 000 people/year, a figure significantly higher than their control population (35.5/10,000). South Africa is the epicentre of the HIV pandemic. It is estimated that there are 340,000 (60,000-420,000) children aged 0-14years living with HIV in the country with 10,000 (8,100-20,000) new infections in 2019 [ 3]. New infections amongst South African children has declined, due to the successful implementation of the prevention of mother to child transmission programme. The scourge of HIV in South African children persists, however, with only 47% (36-58) of children receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART) [ 3].
